data.title: Spyglass Entertainment
data.meta_description: Spyglass Entertainment is an American film and television production company, Co-founded by Gary Barber and Roger Birnbaum in 1999, where they serve as Co-CEOs. It's currently owned by Cerberus Capital Management. Jonathan Glickman serves the current President of Production. Internationally...
data.text:
Spyglass Entertainment is an American film and television production company, Co-founded by Gary Barber and Roger Birnbaum in 1999, where they serve as Co-CEOs. It's currently owned by Cerberus Capital Management. Jonathan Glickman serves the current President of Production. Internationally, Warner Bros. has released most films made by Spyglass (with exceptions). Spyglass Entertainment's logo is a man standing in front of an ocean scene looking through a spyglass. The company was previously known as Path√© Pictures.

Jeffrey Chernov was once a production executive at Spyglass Entertainment.

Filmography[]

With Universal Studios[]

Bruce Almighty (2003)

Seabiscuit (2003) (also with DreamWorks Pictures and Amblin Entertainment)

Connie and Carla (2004) (also with Playtone Productions)

Evan Almighty (2007)

Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins (2008)

Wanted (2008)

Flash of Genius (2008)

Ginger & Rosa (2013, also with Relativity Media and Amblin Entertainment)

With Paramount Pictures[]

Abandon (2002) (also with Touchstone Pictures)

The Perfect Score (2004) (also with MTV Films)

The Love Guru (2008)

Star Trek (2009) (also with Bad Robot Productions)

G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra (2009) (also with Hasbro and Di Bonaventura Pictures)

Dinner for Schmucks (2010)

No Strings Attached (2011) (also with The Montecito Picture Company and Cold Spring Pictures)

Footloose (2011) (co-production with MTV Films)

The Adventures of Casey: Holiday Troubles (2011) (also with Nickelodeon Movies and Amblin Entertainment)

With Sony Pictures Entertainment[]

With Columbia Pictures[]

Almost Famous (2000) (also with DreamWorks Pictures, Imagine Entertainment and Vinyl Films)

The Legend of Zorro (2005) (also with Amblin Entertainment)

Memoirs of a Geisha (2005) (also with DreamWorks Pictures, Amblin Entertainment and Red Wagon Entertainment)

2012 (2009) (also with Relativity Media, Imagine Entertainment and Centropolis Entertainment)

With TriStar Pictures[]

Mansion (2008)

Abducted (2009)

With TimeWarner[]

Four Christmases (2008)

With Warner Bros.[]

Invictus (2009)

The Town (2010) (also with Silver Pictures)

Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close (2011) (also with Alcon Entertainment and Scott Rudin Productions)

With Twentieth Century Fox[]

27 Dresses (2008) (also with RatPac-Dune Entertainment)

The Happening (2008) (also with Blinding Edge Pictures)

With Disney[]

Tuck Everlasting (2002)

Eight Below (2006)

Underdog (2007)

With Hollywood Pictures[]

The Sixth Sense (1999)

With Hollywood Pictures[]

Spy Kids: Armageddon (2023)
